message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.MM 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) category as it deals with visual tracking across illumination change. It also involves sparse signal processing, which falls under the information theory (cs.IT) category. The proposed algorithm involves importance sampling and posterior mode tracking, which are common techniques in machine learning and statistics, making the paper relevant to the machine learning (cs.LG) category. The problem of tracking changing sparsity patterns can also be seen as a control problem, which falls under the systems and control (cs.SY) category. Finally, the paper involves experiments on simulated and real videos, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the multimedia (cs.MM) category.
